alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 26 at 5:50AM EDT until September 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Bronx, Northwest Suffolk, Northeast Suffolk, Northern Queens and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From late this afternoon through this evening. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 2 to 3 ft will result in beach erosion with minor damage possible to dune structures. Splashover bulkheads and dune structures may locally exacerbate flooding for shoreline roads and properties.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bronx; Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk
